abstract.shortdesc: The rule-statement presents the individual rules associated with an element.

rule.rule-statement: Rule statements apply to a specific element.
rule.justification: The style guide is organized by element, readers will search the guide using the element names in the title. The reader will expect to find all the relevant rules associated with the element.

examplefig.desc: The rule is specific to the topic.
examplefig.codeblock: <title>Quotes> ... <rule-statement>To quote blocks of text use the long quotes element <lq>.

examplefig.desc: The rule-statement contains references to multiple items. The reasons for the rule vary according to which element is used; the justification cannot address both issues.
examplefig.codeblock: <title>Whitespace</title> ... <rule-statement>Do not add any white spaces or special punctuation immediately inside quotation elements.</rule-statement>

rule.rule-statement: Use <conref> to share rule statements between elements.
rule.justification: Because readers use the title of the topic to find rules, generic rules should appear in all relevant topics.

examplefig.desc: The inclusion of multiple use-cases means that this <rule-statement> is not found in all the right places and can be missed by busy readers.
examplefig.codeblock: <rule-statement>When titles in concepts, reference, or troubleshooting topics can be expressed as acronyms, reference their glossentry.</rule-statement>
